optimize_theme.txt_upgrade: Exclusive to Premium plans or higher

banner.title: New to theme and code optimization?
banner.des: From files clean-up, code minification, to user experience optimization. Let's get started by exploring the numerous techniques we cover.

banner_limit_theme.title: Theme limit reached, remove a theme to continue
banner_limit_theme.des: You've reached the theme limit of your Shopify plan, so you need to remove a theme before Swift can duplicate and add a new one.

banner_warning_police.des: To minimize risks, we duplicate your Online Store's theme during optimization, but please note that the duplicate won't receive automatic updates from Shopify.

banner_skip_trial.des: There are some limitations because your store is still in trial. To access and fully use all features, please skip the trial.

lazyload-images.title: Lazyload images
lazyload-images.des: Load only the images that are visible to users on their first visit. Additional images are dynamically loaded as they scroll down.

critical-css.title: Extract critical CSS
critical-css.des: Isolate and prioritize essential styles to render above-the-fold content quickly for improved webpage display.

optimize-css.title: Minify CSS files
optimize-css.des: Remove unnecessary spacing, indentation, newlines, and comments. Make it easier and faster to transmit the code over the Internet.

optimize-html.title: Clean up HTML files
optimize-html.des: Remove unnecessary characters, spaces, and line breaks to render pages faster, thus improving loading speed without affecting functionality.

optimize-js.title: Minify JavaScript files
optimize-js.des: Shorten variable and function names, reducing the data transmitted over the network. Enable the browser to parse and execute the code more quickly.

preload-fonts.title: Preload web fonts
preload-fonts.des: The browser will download font files sooner, resulting in faster text display and improved overall loading speed.

optimize-html-plus.title: HTML file optimization
optimize-html-plus.des: Improve response time by using external CSS and JavaScript files, efficient resource usage, and appropriate HTML tags.
optimize-html-plus.explan_use: Exclusive to Premium Plus plans billed annually or higher

publish_theme.title: Your optimized theme is now ready
publish_theme.des: You can also preview and publish it from the theme list in your Shopify Online Store. It will appear as ‚ÄúOptimized by Swift‚Äù (e.g., Optimized by Swift-Dawn).
publish_theme.tooltip: Take a minute to make sure everything is working well before publishing.

banner.title: Publishing theme...

modal_publish.des: After publishing, you can always reset to the original theme within your Shopify Online Store section.

modal_delete_theme.des: Once deleted, you cannot undo this action. <break /> Starting over may take some time.

modal_publish_success.des: Your theme has been published and is now available for others to use.

modal_bug_feature.des: Your theme contains a minor conflicting code installed by another app. To resolve this issue with manual support, please contact us.

section_redirect_home.title: Redirect to home page
section_redirect_home.des: When Shopify cannot find a page for a specific link, it will show your theme's 404 - Not Found page. Turn on this option to redirect the visitor to your homepage shortly after displaying the 404 page.

section_send_email.title: Send alert email when detected
section_send_email.des: When Swift logs a new 404 error, it will alert you by email. When actively tracking 404 errors, you should visit the app frequently to create manual redirects until all the 404s are eliminated.

0.title: What is a Broken link?
0.des: Your shop will generate 404 errors when a visitor lands on a missing page, usually from an old backlink on an external website or social platform. You may have missing pages if you've recently changed your page or product urls. You can fix a 404 error by creating a redirect from the old link to a new link. Once you activate the 404 capture, come back in a few days to see if any visitors have reached your 404 page.

1.title: Will this install code on my shop?
1.des: While this tool does add an extra line of javascript to log the 404 errors, it does not add any code that affects the performance of your site. Also, it uses App Theme Extensions to add the code safely and it is removed automatically by Shopify whenever the app is uninstalled.

banner_component.title: Maximize your website's performance

banner_component.SEODes: The best marketers enjoy and love what they do. Swift ensures marketing professionals always have time for creativity and experiments while we take care of data. Swift is the only software which enables marketing professionals to build, manage, and measure campaigns across all channels to improve their online visibility. Swift is your digital team member‚Äîyour analytics buddy, your mentor, your safety net, and a compass to new markets.

store_speed_component.feat_des2: Reduce the Java script of the third-party apps without causing any interruption.

perfomance_component.title: Only $150, maximize your website's perfomance with OneExperts

customer_say_component.title: WHAT DO OUR CUSTOMERS SAY?
customer_say_component.review_des1: The app literally saved my store. Before I used the  OneExperts I had 25 in Score on Google site Speed and 40 on computer. After I payed which was very cheap, I got 96 on computer and 78 on mobile. You lose about 65% of your customers if you have a similar score to what I had. Thank you
customer_say_component.review_des2: I can't put into words how amazing this app was and for an additional $150 they cleaned up code and got us from a Google lighthouse score of 35 to 95. We have spent a year trying to accomplish this and they did it in 2 days. They have my highest recommendations.
customer_say_component.review_des3: Absolutely brilliant app & the support couldn't be more helpful. I have used the  OneExperts Service to boost my store speed. The price was very reasonable & the results are excellent. My store mobile speed has increased by around 30 points. So happy. I can't recommend highly enough.

questions_component.title: Got a question? Get help anytime, 24/7
questions_component.des: We have tested on thousands of stores to find out what works best. We believe good ideas are worth spreading.

0.title: Do I need to provide store permission for the process to start?
0.des: Yes, we need Apps, Themes, Product, and Reports permissions to evaluate and optimize your store speed. Therefore, you will need to provide us with a Staff account with those permission in order to do our job. Also, we do have a Privacy policy here, so please do not worry about leaking your valuable information.

1.title: What can I expect from OneExperts service?
1.des:
A higher mobile speed score on Google PageSpeed Insights Senior Developers with 5+ years of experience in the Shopify market will take care of your website speed. Depending on the current situation and your store structure, we might optimize your store using these techniques:
- Lazy load images and videos
- Render images in a proper size
- Minify JS/CSS code
- Implement preloading tactics
- Optimize CSS and Liquid code
- App analysis
We'll monthly check up on your speed performance after optimizing and you will be consulted for free by our Customer Support Specialist.

2.title: Will optimization affect the design of my store?
2.des: No, our optimization process will only boost your store speed and won't affect anything else (layout, components, features...). To make sure things are safe, we only optimize on the duplicated theme and you can review it before publishing it in your store.

3.title: What if I notice there is no improvement after optimization?
3.des: As we guarantee to bring positive results, we will provide a full refund if the site is not optimized at all. You can read our refund policy here

4.title: Can I make changes to the site while your team is working on it?
4.des: We highly recommend to only have 1 person working on the site at a time. The reason is that since we work on a backup theme, if you make any changes to your live theme during our optimization process, you will have to apply those edits to our working theme as well, so it should be better to avoid any unnecessary changes until we finish our job.

5.title: Are the changes you make future-proof?
5.des:
We try our best to make future-proof as much as possible by editing the Liquid theme code and using JavaScript anywhere when applicable. Therefore the edits we perform on your theme are generally long-lasting. We also provide recommendations in the report at the end of the project to give you information for the future. Keep in mind that any changes you make after we have done the optimization task can easily affect our final testing result. We should not have any responsibility in case your store speed becomes worse. Those changes include but are not limited to:
- Change your theme template/structure
- Change the design of your website (font, images, videos, contents, etc.)
- Add more products to your store
- Add more third-party apps
- Delete our optimize code without our notice
In that case, we can do a Free technical analysis for you, and if needed, you would need to open a new request for us to optimize your store again.

0.title: What is image alt text?
0.des: Image alt text, also known as alternative text or alt tags, is a descriptive text attribute that is used to provide information about an image on a webpage. It is an HTML attribute that is added to the image tag's code.<break />When an image cannot be displayed on a webpage for various reasons (such as slow loading, broken link, or when using a screen reader), the alt text serves as a substitute to describe the image's content. The alt text is read aloud by screen readers, allowing visually impaired users to understand the context and meaning of the image within the webpage. <break />Including appropriate alt text for images improves the accessibility of a webpage, ensures a better user experience for individuals with visual impairments, and helps search engines interpret and index the content accurately.

1.title: What should I use for the alt text pattern?
1.des: We highly recommend sticking with our default template.

2.title: How long does it take to update my alt texts?
2.des: This depends on how many images you have. Wait times can be anywhere from a couple of minutes up to a couple of hours depending on the time of day.

3.title: Will Auto alt texts and Bulk alt texts overwrite my current alt texts?
3.des: No. Auto alt texts and Bulk alt texts will not overwrite your current alt texts. <break />These features are designed to complement your existing alt texts by automatically adding alt texts to newly uploaded images (Auto alt texts) and allowing you to quickly add alt texts in bulk to images without alt texts (Bulk alt texts). <break />These features aim to assist you in efficiently generating alt texts for your images without compromising or altering any pre-existing alt texts that you may already have in place.

section_auto_setting.title: Auto meta tags
section_auto_setting.des: Automatically add meta title and meta description to new added products using the meta tag pattern set up before.

section_example.des: Meta tags are crucial for SEO and user experience, influencing search engine indexing and display. They provide details about a webpage's content, including title, description, and other relevant information.

0.title: How to change the meta tags of the homepage?
0.des: Shopify does not allow the changing of the homepage meta tags through the Shopify API and therefore you can only change these through the Shopify admin. Open the Shopify admin/backend and go to Online Store -> Preferences. There you have the homepage title and the homepage meta description.

1.title: I do not see the meta tags in the Shopify admin/backend?
1.des: Smart SEO generates the meta tags on the fly rather than alter the Shopify backend. That is why you can‚Äôt see the updated meta tags in the Shopify Search Engine Listing Preview. To check the actual meta tags, please open a product page in your browser, right click on it and choose ‚ÄòView page source‚Äù. Once the HTML of the page is loaded press CTRL + F and search for the word ‚Äò<title>‚Äô. This will position you on the meta title tag. The meta description is right below it. If you do not see the meta tags that you expect it might be that the app is not properly integrated, which leads us to the next question.

add_bulk.title: Bulk meta tags
add_bulk.des: Detect pages that are missing meta title or meta description. Quickly add them to products using the meta tag pattern set up before.

0.title: What are meta tags?
0.des: Page meta tags (including Meta Title and Meta Description) show how your page appears on Search Engine Result Pages for people to be inclined to click through.

1.title: Why are my Page meta tags different in Google search pages?
1.des: It takes about 7-14 days for Google to update your change. Google needs a period of time to crawl all the sites it can recognize. So when Google has done crawling, you can see the change at the Google search result pages.

2.title: Meta Tags are still missing despite being updated?
2.des: One reason for this issue is that your site is Password protection page, so the information will not be read by any outsider‚Äôs tool including ours. Another possible reason is using lazy load for site's speed <break />Improvements which prevents search engines from crawling the entire page and neither do we.

banner.title: Did you know that your Shopify admin has a perfectly good tool to manage your redirects? If you need to view, add, or edit redirects, that's the best place to do it!
banner.des: You can find it at Admin > Online Store > Navigation > View Url Redirects (top right corner)

field_domain.help_text: Enter full path. Leave empty to redirect to homepage.

0.title: Does this app automatically create redirects?
0.des: SEO King automatically creates redirects anytime it modifies page URLs. It will also delete unecessary redirects as it processes your products and pages. However, you should always turn on the 404 Errors tool to keep an eye on any old links that may be sending visitors to a non-existant page.

1.title: Will this app create redirects for multi-lingual shops?
1.des: Yes, anytime SEO King renames the urls for any products, collections, articles and pages, a redirect will be created for each published language if you use the 'folder' style domain for multi-lingual shops. If you have many published languages, processing times may take longer than estimated.

task_connect.title: Connect to Google Search Console
task_connect.des: Please ensure that you check all of the boxes on the Google authorization page

task_add_site.title: Add your store website to Google

task_verify_site.title: Verify your store website with Google

0.title: What is a sitemap?
0.des: A sitemap is a file that provides a list of all the pages and significant content on a website. When you generate a sitemap for your Shopify store, it includes important links to products, pages, collections, and blog posts. Search engines like Google use this sitemap.xml file to efficiently crawl and index your store's content, ultimately helping your pages rank higher in search results.

1.title: What is the difference between a Shopify sitemap and an advanced sitemap?
1.des: While every merchant is provided with a default Shopify sitemap, it may not include all the available data points. For example, it typically includes only one photo per product. In contrast, the advanced sitemaps generated by this app offer a more comprehensive representation, including article and page sitemaps, allowing a larger majority of your photos and other images to be effectively delivered to search engines.
